alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; San Francisco River Valley; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 10:30PM MST until January 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches except between 3 and 6 inches above 7500 feet. Amounts up to 10 inches possible across the peaks. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Mountains, Northwest Plateau, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, San Francisco River Valley, and San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 from the Arizona border across the Continental Divide. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow may reduced visibility to less than one mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; San Francisco River Valley; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
